sen.j: 長宗我部 盛親（ちょうそかべ もりちか）は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代前期の土佐国の大名・武将。
sen.e: Morichika CHOSOKABE was a daimyo and busho (Japanese military commander) in Tosa Province who lived from the Azuchi Momoyama Period to the beginning of the Edo Period.
Morichika CHOSOKABE was a daimyo and busho (Japanese military commander) in Tosa Province who lived from the Azuchi Momoyama Period to the beginning of the Edo Period.
Morichika CHOSOKABE was a daimyo and busho (Japanese military commander) in Tosa Province who lived from the Azuchi Momoyama Period to the beginning of the Edo Period.

tit.e: Succession to the position of family head
Succession to the position of family head
Succession to the position of family head

sen.j: 天正3年（1575年）、四国の覇者として名高かった長宗我部元親の四男に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1575, he was born as the fourth son of Motochika CHOSOKABE, who was famous as a supreme ruler of Shikoku
In 1575, he was born as the fourth son of Motochika CHOSOKABE, who was famous as a supreme ruler of Shikoku
In 1575, he was born as the fourth son of Motochika CHOSOKABE, who was famous as a supreme ruler of Shikoku.

sen.j: 天正14年（1586年）の戸次川の戦いで長兄の長宗我部信親が戦死すると、兄の香川親和や津野親忠を推す一派と家督相続をめぐって争うことになる。
sen.e: After his eldest brother Nobuchika CHSOKABE died in the Battle of Hetsugi-gawa River in 1575, he was obliged to contest the inheritance of the position of family head with a group that proposes his elder brother, Chikakazu KAGAWA or Chikatada TSUNO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After his eldest brother Nobuchika CHSOKABE died in the Battle of Hetsugi-gawa River in 1575, he was obliged to contest the inheritance of the position as family head with a group that proposed his elder brother, Chikakazu KAGAWA or Chikatada TSUNO.

After his eldest brother Nobuchika CHSOKABE died in the Battle of Hetsugi-gawa River in 1586, he was obliged to contest the inheritance of the position as a family head with a group that proposed his elder brother, Chikakazu KAGAWA or Chikatada TSUNO.
sen.cmt: 年号を修正しました。family の前に a を挿入しました。

sen.j: 父の強硬な後押しがあり、天正16年（1588年）に世子に指名された。
sen.e: Thanks to his father's strong backup, he was appointed to the heir in 1588.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thanks to his father's strong backing, he was appointed to the heir in 1588.
Thanks to his father's strong backing, he was appointed to the heir in 1588.

sen.j: このときの家督相続には吉良親実をはじめとして反対する者が少なくなかったが、元親はそれらを全て処断している。
sen.e: Not a few persons to begin with Chikazane KIRA were against this succession to the position of family head, and Motochika punished all of them.
Many, to begin with Chikazane KIRA were against this succession to the position of family head, and Motochika punished all of them.
Starting with Chikazane KIRA, many people were against this succession to the position of the family head, but Motochika punished all of them.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: さらに元親が幼少である千熊丸を世子に指名した理由は、親和と親忠は他の家系をすでに継いでいたことと、なによりも溺愛していた信親の娘を娶わせるには、上の2人では年齢差がありすぎたためともされている。
sen.e: The reason why Motochika appointed Senkumamaru [千熊丸 正しい読み不明], who was infant, to the heir was that Chikakazu and Chikatada had already succeeded other family lines and that, above all, the difference in age was too big with two elder sons in order to marry Nobuchika's daughter whom Motochika doted.

The reason why Motochika appointed Senkumamaru [千熊丸 正しい読み不明], who was an infant, to the heir was that Chikakazu and Chikatada had already succeeded other family lines and that, above all, the difference in age was too great with two elder sons in order to marry Nobuchika's daughter whom Motochika doted.

The reason why Motochika appointed Chikumamaru, who was an infant, to the heir was that Chikakazu and Chikatada had already succeeded other family lines and that, above all, age differences between two elder sons and Nobuchika's daughter whom Motochika doted were too great to get married.
sen.cmt: SenkumamaruをChikumamaruに変えました。一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 元服のときは、豊臣氏の重臣・増田長盛を烏帽子親として「盛」の一字を授かって盛親と名乗った。
sen.e: When he celebrated his coming of age, eboshioya (a person who put on an eboshi in the case of genpuku ceremony) was Nagamori MASUDA, who was a key vassal of the Toyotomi clan and he was given a character "盛 (mori)" and used the name of "Morichika."

When he celebrated his coming of age, eboshioya (a person who put on an eboshi in the event of a genpuku ceremony) was Nagamori MASUDA, who was a key vassal of the Toyotomi clan and he was given the character "盛 (mori)" and used the name of "Morichika."

When he celebrated his coming of age, eboshioya (a person who put on an eboshi in the event of a genpuku ceremony) was Nagamori MASUDA, who was a key vassal of the Toyotomi clan and he was given the character '盛 (mori)' and used the name of Morichika.
sen.cmt: " を ' に変更し、本文にない " は削除しました。

sen.j: 長宗我部家の家督に決定した後、父・元親とともに天正18年（1590年）の小田原征伐、天正20年（1592年）からの朝鮮出兵に参加する。
sen.e: After he was appointed as the heir of the family head, he took part in, together with his father Motochika, the conquest and siege of Odawara in 1590 and Invasion of Korea since 1592.
After he was appointed as the heir to be the head of the family, he took part in, together with his father Motochika, the conquest and siege of Odawara in 1590 and the Invasion of Korea from 1592.
After he was appointed as the heir to be the head of the family, he took part in, together with his father Motochika, the conquest and siege of Odawara in 1590 and the Invasion of Korea from 1592.

sen.j: 慶長2年（1597年）、3月24日には父元親と共に制定した長宗我部元親百箇条を発布している。
sen.e: On March 24, 1597, he promulgated Chosokabe Motochika Hyakkajo (literally, one hundred articles of rule of Motochika CHOSOKABE), which he stipulated together with his father, Motochika.
On March 24, 1597, he promulgated Chosokabe Motochika Hyakkajo (literally, one hundred articles of rule of Motochika CHOSOKABE), which he stipulated together with his father, Motochika.
On May 10, 1597, he promulgated Chosokabe Motochika Hyakkajo (literally, one hundred articles of the rules of Motochika CHOSOKABE), which he stipulated together with his father, Motochika.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。ruleをthe rulesに変更しました。

sen.j: 慶長4年（1599年）5月、父・元親の死去により、家督を継いで土佐の国主となる。
sen.e: In May 1599, as his father, Motochika, died, he inherited the position of family head and became the kokushu (landed daimyo) of Tosa.
In May 1599, as his father, Motochika, died, he inherited the position as head of the family and became the kokushu (landed daimyo) of Tosa.
In June 1599, as his father Motochika died, he inherited the position as head of the family and became the lord of Tosa.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）、関ヶ原の戦いが起こる。
sen.e: In 1600, the Battle of Sekigahara occurred.
In 1600, the Battle of Sekigahara took place.
In 1600, the Battle of Sekigahara took place.

sen.j: 当初、盛親は徳川家康率いる東軍に与しようと考えた。
sen.e: At first, Morichika intended to join up with the East squad.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At first, Morichika intended to join up with the Eastern forces.
At first, Morichika intended to join up with the Eastern forces led by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: led by Ieyasu TOKUGAWAを加えました。

sen.j: 近江国水口で西軍に属する長束正家に進路を阻まれて、やむなく西軍に与した。
sen.e: However, he had his way blocked by Masaie NATSUKA, who belonged to the West squad, at Minakuchi in Omi Province and unwillingly joined up with the West squad.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he had his way blocked by Masaie NATSUKA, who belonged to the Western forces at Minakuchi in Omi Province and he unwillingly joined up with the Western forces.
However, he had his way blocked by Masaie NATSUKA, who belonged to the Western forces, at Minakuchi in Omi Province and he was forced to join up with the Western forces.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 盛親は、西軍の主力部隊となって東軍に与する各城を落としながら関ヶ原に向かった。
sen.e: Morichika formed the main-force unit of the West squad and headed for Sekigahara taking castles that joined up with the East squad, by assault,.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Morichika formed the main-force unit of the Western forces and headed for Sekigahara assulting and taking castles that had joined up with the Eastern forces,.
Morichika formed the main-force unit of the Western forces and headed for Sekigahara assaulting and taking castles that had joined up with the Eastern forces,.
sen.cmt: assulting を assulting に変更しました。

sen.j: 関ヶ原では徳川家康に内応する吉川広家が前に居座って動かず、実際の戦闘には加わることが出来ないまま西軍は壊滅した。
sen.e: In Sekigahara, while he could not take part in the actual battle because Hiroie KIKKAWA, who took Ieyasu TOKUGAWA' side, settled down in front of him, the Wrest squad was annihilated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Sekigahara, while he could not take part in the actual battle because Hiroie KIKKAWA, who took Ieyasu TOKUGAWA'S side, settled down in front of him, the Western forces were annihilated.
In Sekigahara, while he could not take part in the actual battle because Hiroie KIKKAWA, who took Ieyasu TOKUGAWA'S side, settled down in front of him, the Western forces were annihilated.

tit.e: Kaieki (punishment by removal of samurai status and expropriation of territories)
Kaieki (punishment by removal of samurai status and expropriation of territories)
Kaieki (punishment by removal of samurai status and expropriation of territories)

sen.j: 西軍壊滅後、盛親は軍を率いて領国の土佐に逃げ帰った。
sen.e: After the West squad had been annihilated, Morichika ran back his territory, Tosa, commanding his troop.
After the Western forces had been annihilated, Morichika ran back to his territory, Tosa, commanding his troops.
After the Western forces were annihilated, Morichika ran back to his territory, Tosa, commanding his troops.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 土佐物語によると、盛親は懇意にあった徳川家康の重臣・井伊直政を通じて家康に謝罪した。
sen.e: According to Tosa Monogatari, Morichika apologized to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA through Ieyasu's key vassal, Naomasa II, to whom Morichika had been close.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to Tosa Monogatari, Morichika apologized to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA through Ieyasu's key vassal, Naomasa II, to whom Morichika had been close.
According to Tosa Monogatari, Morichika apologized to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA through Ieyasu's key vassal, Naomasa II, to whom Morichika had been close.

sen.j: 家臣・久武親直の讒言から兄の津野親忠を殺害してしまい、家康の怒りを買って、領土没収で改易となってしまった。
sen.e: As Mochichika killed his elder brother, Chikatada TSUNO because of slander by Morichika's vassal, Chikanao HISATAKE, however, he invited cited Ieyasu's anger and he was deprived of his position and territory.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As Mochichika killed his elder brother, Chikatada TSUNO because of slander by Morichika's vassal, Chikanao HISATAKE, however, he invited Ieyasu's anger and was deprived of his position and territory.
As Morichika killed his elder brother, Chikatada TSUNO because of slander by Morichika's vassal, Chikanao HISATAKE, he invited Ieyasu's anger and was deprived of his position and territory.
sen.cmt: MochichikaをMorichikaに変更しました。howeverを削除しました。

sen.j: その後、盛親は京都へ送られ、身一つの謹慎生活を送る事になった。
sen.e: Then, Morichika was sent to Kyoto and forced to behave himself with just the clothes he wore.
Then, Morichika was sent to Kyoto and forced to behave himself with just the clothes he wore.
Then, Morichika was sent to Kyoto and forced to behave himself with just the clothes he wore.

sen.j: 京都では大岩祐夢と名前を変え、旧臣らの仕送りで暮らしていたといわれるが、寺子屋の師匠をして身を立てていたとの記録もある。
sen.e: It is told that, in Kyoto, he changed his name to Yumu OIWA [大岩祐夢 正しい読み不明] and lived on remittance from his former vassals and there is a record that he earned living as a teacher of terakoya (a private elementary school in the Edo period).

It is told that, in Kyoto, he changed his name to Yumu OIWA [大岩祐夢 正しい読み不明] and lived on remittances from his former vassals and there is a record that he earned a living as a teacher of terakoya (a private elementary school during the Edo period).

It is told that, in Kyoto, he changed his name to Yumu OIWA [大岩祐夢 正しい読み不明] and lived on remittances from his former vassals and there is a record that he earned a living as a teacher of terakoya (a private elementary school during the Edo period).

sen.j: また清原秀賢と交友があったとの記録も残っている。
sen.e: There is a record that he maintained friendship with KIYOHARA no Hidekata.
It isrecorded that he maintained a friendship with KIYOHARA no Hidekata.
It is recorded that he maintained a friendship with KIYOHARA no Hidekata.
sen.cmt: is の後にスペースを挿入しました。

tit.j: 大坂の役八尾・若江合戦
tit.e: Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka)/Battles of Yao and Wake
Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka)/Battles of Yao and Wake
Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka)/Battles of Yao and Wakae
tit.cmt: Wake を Wakae にしました。

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）秋、大阪方と徳川方との間が風雲急を告げる中、豊臣秀頼からの招きで大坂城に入城した。
sen.e: In 1614, while, he entered the Osakajo Castle by invitation from Hideyori TOYOTOMI.
In 1614, while, he entered the Osakajo Castle by invitation from Hideyori TOYOTOMI.
In the fall of 1614, while the relationship between Osaka forces and Tokugawa forces was straining, he entered the Osakajo Castle by invitation from Hideyori TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 大坂の役では真田信繁などの活躍で盛親に出番はなかったが(真田丸の守備は真田信繁と盛親が共同で行っていたという説もある)、大坂の役では豊臣家重臣の木村重成らとともに2万の主力軍勢で徳川家の藤堂高虎と戦った。
sen.e: In Osaka no Eki, because of splendid actions by Nobushige SANADA, etc., there Morichika could have no part to play (there is a view that guard of the Sanadamaru was conducted by Nobushige SANADA and Morichika jointly), but, in Osaka no Eki, he lead the main-force units of twenty thousand together with Shigenari KIMURA, who was a key vassal of the Toyotomi family, fought with Takatora TODO of the Tokugawa family.

In Osaka no Eki, because of the splendid performance by Nobushige SANADA, etc., Morichika could have no part to play (there is a view that guard of the Sanadamaru was conducted by Nobushige SANADA and Morichika jointly), but, in Osaka no Eki, he led the main-force units of twenty thousand together with Shigenari KIMURA, who was a key vassal of the Toyotomi family, and fought with Takatora TODO of the Tokugawa family.

In Osaka no Eki, because of the splendid performance by Nobushige SANADA, etc., Morichika could have no part to play (there is a view that guard of the Sanadamaru was conducted by Nobushige SANADA and Morichika jointly), but, in Osaka no Eki, he led the main-force units of twenty thousand together with Shigenari KIMURA, who was a key vassal of the Toyotomi family, and fought with Takatora TODO of the Tokugawa family.

sen.j: 慶長20年（1615年）5月6日の未明、長宗我部隊の先鋒が藤堂高虎隊を発見した。
sen.e: At dawn on May 6, 1615, the vanguard of Chosokabe troop found the troop of Takatora TODO.
At dawn on May 6, 1615, the vanguard of Chosokabe troop found the troop of Takatora TODO.
Early on June 2, 1615, the vanguard of Chosokabe troop found the troop of Takatora TODO.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。At dawn を early on に変更しました。

sen.j: この時、長宗我部の先鋒は軽装備であったため、盛親は先鋒をすぐに本隊に合流させようとしたが、逆に藤堂隊にも発見されてしまう。
sen.e: On this occasion, the vanguard of Chosokabe was lightly equipped, Morichika tried to make the vanguard join the main body of the troop, but it had found by the troop of Todo.
On this occasion, the vanguard of Chosokabe was lightly equipped, Morichika tried to make the vanguard join the main body of the troop, but it had found by the troop of Todo.
On this occasion, the vanguard of Chosokabe was lightly equipped, Morichika tried to make the vanguard join with the main unit of the troops, but it was found by the troops of Todo.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 鉄砲を撃ち込まれた先鋒は打ち破られてしまう。
sen.e: The vanguard was defeated with gunfighting.
The vanguard was defeated with guns.
The vanguard was defeated with guns.

sen.j: 勢いに乗じて藤堂隊は長宗我部隊を叩き潰そうと軍を動かしたが、盛親は川の堤防に陣を敷き、藤堂隊が近づいたところで一気に槍を構えた兵を突撃させた。
sen.e: Taking advantage of the situation, the troop of Todo marched to crush the troop of Chosokabe, but Morichika took up a position beside the embankment of the river and make warriors holding a spear in their hands rush at once when the troop of Todo came closed to them.

Taking advantage of the situation, the troops of Todo marched to crush the troops of Chosokabe, but Morichika took up a position beside the embankment of the river and made the warriors hold spears in their hands, rush at once when the troops of Todo came close to them.

Taking advantage of the situation, the troops of Todo marched to crush the troops of Chosokabe, but Morichika took up a position beside an embankment of the river and made the warriors hold spears in their hands, rushed at once when the troops of Todo came close to them.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: その突撃の勢いは凄まじく、藤堂隊の先陣は一気に壊滅した。
sen.e: The power of the rush was so tremendous that the vanguard of the troop of Todo was suddenly annihilated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The power of the rush was so tremendous that the vanguard of the troop of Todo was suddenly annihilated.
The power of the rush was so tremendous that the vanguard of the troops of Todo was annihilated at a stretch.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 盛親が攻撃の手を緩めなかったため、藤堂隊はほぼ壊滅状態になり、高虎の甥の藤堂高刑などが戦死し、高虎も逃げ回らざるを得ない有様だった。
sen.e: As Morichika did not ease attack, the troop of Todo was almost annihilated and Takanori TODO, who was Takatora's nephew, etc. were killed in the battle and Takatora also was forced to run from place to place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As Morichika did not ease attack, the Todo troops were almost annihilated and Takanori TODO, who was Takatora's nephew, etc. were killed in the battle and Takatora also was forced to run from place to place.

As Morichika did not ease attack, the Todo troops were almost annihilated and Takanori TODO, who was Takatora's nephew, etc. were killed in the battle and Takatora also was forced to run from place to place.

sen.j: 武将を一度に失った藤堂隊は、指揮命令系統も潰れてもはや統制も利かず敗走寸前に陥ったが、井伊直孝の隊が駆けつけた。
sen.e: Having lost many commanders all at once, the chain of command of the troop of Todo was crushed and they were almost put to rout, but the troop of Naotaka II rushed to the scene.
Having lost many commanders all at once, the chain of command of the troop of Todo was crushed and they were almost put to rout, but the troop of Naotaka II rushed to the scene.
Having lost many commanders all at once, the chain of command of the troops of Todo was crushed and they were almost put to rout, but the troops of Naotaka II rushed to the scene.

sen.j: この援軍の登場により、木村重成が戦死、他の諸部隊も壊滅したため、撤退を余儀なくされる。
sen.e: Because of appearance of this reinforcement, Shigenari KUMURA died in the battle and other troops also annihilated, Morichika was forced to retreat.
Because of the appearance of these reinforcements, Shigenari KUMURA died in the battle and other troops were also annihilated, Morichika was forced to retreat.
Because of the appearance of these reinforcements, Shigenari KUMURA died in the battle and other troops were also annihilated, Morichika was forced to retreat.

sen.j: 勝利を諦めた盛親は次の日の大坂城近郊での最終決戦には参加せず、大坂城･京橋口の守りについていた。
sen.e: Morichika gave up victory and did not take part in the last battle in the vicinity of the Osaka-jo Castle next day and guarded the Kyobashiguchi of the Osaka-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Morichika gave up trying for victory and did not take part in the last battle near Osaka-jo Castle the next day and instead guarded the Kyobashiguchi of the Osaka-jo Castle.
Morichika gave up trying for victory and did not take part in the last battle near Osaka-jo Castle the next day and instead guarded the Kyobashiguchi of the Osaka-jo Castle.

sen.j: 敗北が決定的になると「我ら運さえ良ければ天下は大坂たるよ」と言い残し再起を図って逃亡した。
sen.e: When the defeat became decisive, he fled to try to come back saying "If we could be lucky, the whole country would be in the hand of Osaka side."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the defeat became decisive, he fled to try to go back saying "If we are lucky, the whole country could be in the hands of the Osaka side."
When the defeat became decisive, he fled to try to come back saying 'If we are lucky, the whole country could be in the hands of the Osaka side.'
sen.cmt: goをcomeに変更しました。 " を ' に変更しました。

sen.j: だが運は盛親に味方せず、5月11日京都八幡近くの葭原に潜んでいるところを、蜂須賀家の家臣･長坂七郎左衛門に見つかり捕らえられる。
sen.e: Morichika could not be lucky, however, and he was found and captured by Shichirozaemon NAGASAKA, who was a vassal of the Hachisuka clan when he was in hiding in a field of reeds,
Morichika was not lucky, however, and he was found and captured by Shichirozaemon NAGASAKA, who was a vassal of the Hachisuka clan when he was in hiding in a field of reeds,

But luck was not Morichika's side and he was found and captured by Shichirozaemon NAGASAKA, who was a vassal of the Hachisuka family, when he was hiding in a field of reeds near Yawata in Kyoto on June 7.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: その後、盛親は見せしめのために二条城門外の柵に縛りつけられた。
sen.e: Later, Morichika was bound to the fence outside of the gate of the Nijo-jo Castle as warning to others.
Later, Morichika was bound to the fence outside of the gate of the Nijo-jo Castle as warning to others.
Later, Morichika was bound to the fence outside of the gate of the Nijo-jo Castle as warning to others.

sen.j: そして5月15日に京都の六条河原で6人の子女とともに斬首され、三条河原で梟首された。
sen.e: On May 15, he was beheaded together with six children in Rokujo Gawara in Kyoto and his head was gibbeted in Sanjo Gawara.
On May 15, he was beheaded together with six children in Rokujo Gawara in Kyoto and his head was gibbeted in Sanjo Gawara.
On June 11, he was beheaded together with six children in Rokujo Gawara in Kyoto and his head was gibbeted in Sanjo Gawara.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 享年41。
sen.e: He was forty-one years old, when he died.
He was forty-one years old, when he died.
He was forty-one years old, when he died.

sen.j: これにより、長宗我部氏は完全に滅亡した。
sen.e: With this, the Chosokabe clan was totally ruined.
With this, the Chosokabe clan was totally ruined.
With this, the Chosokabe clan was totally ruined.

sen.j: 墓所：京都市五条寺町の蓮光寺。
sen.e: Graveyard: Renko-ji Temple in Gojo-teramachi, Kyoto City.
Grave: Renko-ji Temple in Gojo-teramachi, Kyoto City.
Grave: Renko-ji Temple in Gojo-teramachi, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 領安院殿源翁宗本大居士と諡名された（別の諡名として蓮国一栄大禅定門）。
sen.e: He was give a posthumous name of Shoaninden Genosohon Daikoji (another posthumous name - Renkoku Ichiei Daizenjomon).
sen.cmt: 諡名の正しい読みは確認できませんでした。
sen.e: He was give the posthumous name of Shoaninden Genosohon Daikoji (another posthumous name - Renkoku Ichiei Daizenjomon).
He was given the posthumous name of Shoaninden Genosohon Daikoji (another posthumous name - Renkoku Ichiei Daizenjomon).
sen.cmt: give を given に変更しました。

sen.j: その一方、若狭国の本願寺系の末寺で僧侶になり、一婦人とともに余生を過ごしたとの伝説も残っている。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is a legend that he became a priest in a branch temple of the Honganji school in Wakasa Province and he spent his remaining years with a lady.
On the other hand, there is a legend that he became a priest in a branch temple of the Honganji school in Wakasa Province and he spent his remaining years with a lady.
On the other hand, there is a legend that he became a priest in a branch temple of the Hongan-ji school in Wakasa Province and he spent his remaining years with a lady.
sen.cmt: Honganji を Hongan-ji と変更しました。

sen.j: 身長は6尺（180cm）あったとされ、父と兄（長宗我部信親）同様に当時としては大男であったと言われる。
sen.e: It is told that he was a large man in this period same as his father and elder brother (Nobuchika CHOSOKABE) and he was 180 cm high.
It is told that he was a large man in this period, the same as his father and elder brother (Nobuchika CHOSOKABE) and stood 180 cms tall.
It is told that he was a large man in this period, the same as his father and elder brother (Nobuchika CHOSOKABE) and stood 180 cms tall.

sen.j: また墓所のある蓮光寺には、肖像画（原則非公開）が残されており、父によく似た剛毅な風貌を伝えている。
sen.e: In the Renko-ji Temple where his graveyard exists, his portrait is kept (not open to the public, as a general rule) and his sturdy features, that is very close to father's, can be seen.
In the Renko-ji Temple where his grave exists, his portrait is kept (not open to the public, as a general rule) and his sturdy features, that were very close to father's, can be seen.
In the Renko-ji Temple where his grave exists, his portrait is kept (not open to the public, as a general rule) and his sturdy features, that were very close to father's, can be seen.

sen.j: 大阪の陣で盛親は恩賞として土佐一国を所望したという。
sen.e: It is told that, in Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka), he asked for Tosa, as a whole.
It is told that, in Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka), he asked for Tosa, as a whole.
It is told that, in Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka), he asked for Tosa Province as a reward.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 当時としては豊臣方に勝利のチャンスがあると考えられていたので、盛親が豊臣についたのは旧領奪回の打算があったのは間違いない。
sen.e: Since it was believed at that time that the Toyotomi side could have a good change to win, it is sure that Morichika joined the Toyotomi side to recover his former territory.
Since it was believed at that time that the Toyotomi side could have a good chance to win, it is sure that Morichika joined the Toyotomi side to recover his former territory.
Since it was believed at that time that the Toyotomi side could have a good chance to win, it is sure that Morichika joined the Toyotomi side to recover his former territory.

sen.j: 大坂夏の陣で敗れ、徳川方に捕らえられ白州に引き出された際、「徳川方第一の戦功は八尾で大坂方を破った井伊直孝、大坂方敗戦の因は八尾で敗れた長宗我部盛親」と答えたと言われる。
sen.e: It is told that, after defeated in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), when he was captured by the Tokugawa side and dragged to the trial, he replied "The biggest distinguished war service on the Tokugawa side should be Naotaka II who defeated the Osaka side in Yao, and the cause of defeat of the Osaka side is Motochika CHOSOKABE who was defeated in Yao."

It is told that, after he was defeated in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), when he was captured by the Tokugawa side and dragged to trial, he replied "The biggest distinguished war service on the Tokugawa side should be Naotaka II who defeated the Osaka side in Yao, and the cause of defeat of the Osaka side is Motochika CHOSOKABE who was defeated in Yao."

It is told that, after he was defeated in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), when he was captured by the Tokugawa side and dragged to trial, he replied 'The biggest distinguished war service on the Tokugawa side should be Naotaka II who defeated the Osaka side in Yao, and the cause of defeat of the Osaka side is Motochika CHOSOKABE who was defeated in Yao.'
sen.cmt: " を ' に変更しました。

sen.j: 同じく白州において、自刃もせずに捕らわれたことを徳川方の将兵が蔑むと「命は惜しい。命と右の手がありさえすれば、家康と秀忠をこのような姿にもできたのだ」と言い、「出家するから」とまで言って命乞いをしている。
sen.e: In the same trial, when commanders and warriors of the Tokugawa side condemned him for not having committed suicide by the sword and being captures, he said "I hold my life dear. If I can have my life and right hand, I can make Ieyasu and Hidetada to the same form as I am now." and he begged for his life saying "I will become a priest."

In the same trial, when commanders and warriors of the Tokugawa side condemned him for not having committed suicide by the sword and instead being captured, he said "I hold my life dear. If I can have my life and right hand, I can make Ieyasu and Hidetada into the same form as I am now." and he begged for his life saying "I will become a priest."

In the same trial, when commanders and warriors of the Tokugawa side condemned him for not having committed suicide by the sword and instead being captured, he said 'I hold my life dear. If I can have my life and right hand, I can make Ieyasu and Hidetada into the same form as I am now.' and he begged for his life saying 'I will become a priest.'
sen.cmt: " を ' に変更しました。

sen.j: しかし盛親の胸中を知る徳川家康はこれを許さず、死罪に決したという。
sen.e: However, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who knew Morichika's intention, did not allow this and sentenced him to death.
However, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who knew Morichika's intention, did not allow this and sentenced him to death.
However, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who knew Morichika's intention, did not allow this and sentenced him to death.

sen.j: 二条城の門前に晒された際に、折敷に盛った強飯と赤鰯を足軽からあてがわれ、「戦に負けて捕らわれることは恥としないが、かくも卑陋な物を食わせるとは無礼な奴。早く首を刎ねよ」と怒った。
sen.e: When he was pilloried in front of the gate of the Nijo-jo Castle and he was provided kowaii (steamed rice) and akaiwashi (pickled sardine) put on an oshiki (wooden tray) by an ashigaru (common foot soldier), he got angry and said "I don't feel ashamed to be defeated in the battle and captured, but it is impolite to serve such poor food. Behead me immediately,"

When he was pilloried in front of the gate of the Nijo-jo Castle and he was provided kowaii (steamed rice) and akaiwashi (pickled sardines) put on an oshiki (wooden tray) by an ashigaru (common foot soldier), he got angry and said "I don't feel ashamed to be defeated in battle and captured, but it is impolite to serve such poor food. Behead me immediately,"

When he was pilloried in front of the gate of the Nijo-jo Castle and was provided kowaii (steamed rice) and akaiwashi (pickled sardines) put on an oshiki (wooden tray) by an ashigaru (common foot soldier), he got angry and said 'I don't feel ashamed to be defeated in battle and captured, but it is impolite to serve such poor food. Behead me immediately,'
sen.cmt: " を ' に変更しました。

sen.j: これを聞いた井伊直孝は盛親を座敷に上げて、大名料理で供応した。
sen.e: Having heard this, Naokata II ushered Morichika to drawing room and entertained him with food for daimyo.
Having heard this, Naokata II ushered Morichika to drawing room and entertained him with food good enough for the daimyo.
Having heard this, Naotaka II ushered Morichika to drawing room and entertained him with food good enough for daimyo.
sen.cmt: Naokataを Naotakaに変更しました。daimyoの前のtheを削除しました。

sen.j: 盛親はこの心遣いに感激したという。
sen.e: It is told that Morichika was impressed with this consideration.
It is told that Morichika was impressed with this consideration.
It is told that Morichika was impressed with this consideration.

sen.j: 盛親の最期を記した記録には「死に及んで、いささかも怯じたる気配なし」とあり、その最期は立派だったようである。
sen.e: Because, in a record that describes Morichika's death, it is written as "he showed no timidity at the moment of his death," it seems that his last moment was praiseworthy.
Because, in a record that describes Morichika's death, it is written as "he showed no timidity at the moment of his death," it seems that his last moment was praiseworthy.
Because, in a record that describes Morichika's death, it is written as 'He showed no timidity at the moment of his death,' it seems that his last moment was praiseworthy.
sen.cmt: " を ' に変更しました。Heのhを大文字にしました。

sen.j: 由井正雪の片腕とされた丸橋忠弥は、盛親の側室の次男長宗我部盛澄を名乗った。
sen.e: Chuya MARUHASHI, who was called right-hand man of Shosetsu YUI, named himself Morizumi CHOSOKABE who was the second son of a concubine of Morichika.
Chuya MARUHASHI, who was called the right-hand man of Shosetsu YUI, named himself Morizumi CHOSOKABE who was the second son of a concubine of Morichika.
Chuya MARUHASHI, who was called the right-hand man of Shosetsu YUI, named himself Morizumi CHOSOKABE who was the second son of a concubine of Morichika.

sen.j: 丸橋は母親の生家の苗字。
sen.e: Maruhashi was the family name of his mother's family where she was born..
Maruhashi was the family name of his mother's family where she was born..
Maruhashi was the family name of his mother's family where she was born..

sen.j: 盛親を扱った小説に司馬遼太郎の『戦雲の夢』と、二宮隆雄の『長宗我部盛親』がある。
sen.e: As novels in which Morichika was treated, there are "Senjo no Yume (literally, "dream in the battle field") by Ryotaro SHIBA and "CHOSOKABE Morichika" by Takao NINOMIYA.
Novels telling the story of Morichika, include "Senjo no Yume (literally, "dream in the battle field") by Ryotaro SHIBA and "CHOSOKABE Morichika" by Takao NINOMIYA.
Novels telling the story of Morichika, include "Senjo no Yume (literally, "dream in the battle field") by Ryotaro SHIBA and "CHOSOKABE Morichika" by Takao NINOMIYA.

sen.j: ただし二宮隆雄の本は盛親の最後が歴史と違っている。
sen.e: In the book by Takao NINOMIYA, Morichika's last is different from the history.
In the book by Takao NINOMIYA, Morichika's last is different from recorded history.
In the book by Takao NINOMIYA, Morichika's last is different from recorded history.
